abstract_ssm: Neil Wesson, nee Nathan Weisenfeld (1906-1974) fought with the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in the Spanish Civil War and later served as a weapons sergeant and reconnaissance scout in the United States Army during World War II. The bulk of the collection consists of correspondence from Wesson to his first wife, Sarah Wesson, written during his service in World War II. The collection also includes letters to Wesson from Spanish comrades, items relating to his service in the United States Army, and writings by Wesson, both poetry and prose, which reflect his political beliefs and recall the time he spent with the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain.
